As the military throws everything they have at the creature to little effect, five survivors set off on a dangerous journey across the city to rescue a friend. One of the group documents their journey on a video camera, creating a first-hand record of the carnage. Found-footage thriller, starring Michael Stahl-David and Lizzy Caplan.(n)

programme.title: Creepshow
programme.desc: Anthology of five scary tales paying homage to the cult American EC comics of the 1950s and based on stories by Stephen King, who also makes a cameo appearance. Horror, starring Leslie Nielsen, Carrie Nye and Hal Holbrook.(n)

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond: Special
programme.desc: The making of the latest instalment in the sci-fi series, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Zoe Saldana.(n)

programme.title: Burying the Ex
programme.desc: A young man's dead ex-girlfriend returns from the grave to ruin his new relationship with the woman of his dreams. Can he find a way to silence his former love for good? Comedy horror, starring Anton Yelchin, Ashley Greene and Alexandra Daddario.(n)

programme.title: Serenity
programme.desc: A gang of interplanetary smugglers is pursued by a government assassin searching for a teenage girl who has taken shelter on board their spaceship. Gifted with extraordinary telepathic powers, she has uncovered a secret that threatens the political stability of the universe - and the ruling forces will stop at nothing to ensure it stays buried. Sci-fi adventure based on the TV series Firefly, starring Nathan Fillion, Summer Glau and Chiwetel Ejiofor.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: A clumsy teenager develops superhuman powers after a genetically engineered spider bites him. At first his fantastic skills delight him, but his elation is severely tempered by a family tragedy, prompting him to dedicate his talents to combating evil. However, he faces a baptism of fire in the form of crazed villain the Green Goblin. Comic-book superhero adventure, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Willem Dafoe, James Franco and Rosemary Harris.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: Peter Parker continues his fight for justice, but unrequited love and personal worries take their toll and he is tempted to abandon his web-slinging alter ego. However, the arrival of deadly new bad guy Doctor Octopus plunges him into a race against time to save New York. Comic-book adventure sequel, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Alfred Molina, James Franco and Rosemary Harris.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man 3
programme.desc: A sinister alien parasite brings out the web-slinging hero's darker side, filling him with thoughts of revenge on his uncle's murderer, the shape-shifting Sandman. Meanwhile, he also has to contend with the challenge of his best friend following in his father's villainous footsteps - and a jealous rival developing superpowers of his own. Superhero sequel, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst and James Franco.(n)

programme.title: Serenity
programme.desc: A gang of interplanetary smugglers is pursued by a government assassin searching for a teenage girl who has taken shelter on board their spaceship. Gifted with extraordinary telepathic powers, she has uncovered a secret that threatens the political stability of the universe - and the ruling forces will stop at nothing to ensure it stays buried. Sci-fi adventure based on the TV series Firefly, starring Nathan Fillion, Summer Glau and Chiwetel Ejiofor.(n)

However, he faces a baptism of fire in the form of crazed villain the Green Goblin. Comic-book superhero adventure, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Willem Dafoe, James Franco and Rosemary Harris.(n)

However, the arrival of deadly new bad guy Doctor Octopus plunges him into a race against time to save New York. Comic-book adventure sequel, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Alfred Molina, James Franco and Rosemary Harris.(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man 3
programme.desc: A sinister alien parasite brings out the web-slinging hero's darker side, filling him with thoughts of revenge on his uncle's murderer, the shape-shifting Sandman. Meanwhile, he also has to contend with the challenge of his best friend following in his father's villainous footsteps - and a jealous rival developing superpowers of his own. Superhero sequel, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst and James Franco.(n)

programme.title: The Hurricane
programme.desc: Boxer Rubin `Hurricane' Carter dreams of winning the middleweight world title, only to be wrongfully thrown into prison for the murders of three people in a bar. Nineteen years later, a teenager reads the fighter's autobiography and sets out on a campaign to free him. Fact-based drama, starring Denzel Washington, John Hannah, Deborah Kara Unger, Liev Schreiber and Dan Hedaya.

programme.title: Rawhide
programme.desc: Outlaws hold staff and a passenger and her baby hostage at a remote stagecoach station while awaiting the arrival of a shipment of $100,000 in gold bullion. The nervous captives try to stay calm, but the tension between the gang leader and a jumpy henchman grows fraught, ending in a frantic shoot-out - with the infant in the thick of the fray. Western, starring Tyrone Power, Susan Hayward and Jack Elam.

programme.title: Magic in the Moonlight
programme.desc: An English magician who exposes fake psychics is approached by his friend to prove that a medium is a fraud exploiting a wealthy family. As he watches the spiritualist at work, he begins to believe that she is the genuine article, challenging his previously unshakeable scepticism. Woody Allen's 1920s-set romantic comedy, with Colin Firth and Emma Stone.

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: A troubled philosophy professor begins teaching at a small town college, but struggles to find any meaning in his life. He finds some measure of happiness in his friendship with a student, and when they overhear a stranger's conversation, it spurs the tortured academic on to a course of action that changes everything. Woody Allen's drama, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone and Parker Posey.

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: A US congressman gets embroiled in a secret mission to provide covert military support to rebels in Soviet-occupied Afghanistan. Before long, he finds unlikely allies in the shape of a womanising CIA agent, a Texan socialite and the president of Pakistan. Fact-based political drama set during the 1980s, starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: An inexperienced financial trader is taken under the wing of a corrupt New York corporate raider, who draws him into the shady world of illegal insider dealing with promises of money and power. But the trainee stockbroker questions the morality of his actions when the consequences of a deal strike close to home. Oliver Stone's Oscar-winning drama, starring Michael Douglas, father and son Martin and Charlie Sheen, Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp.

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Hapless Sonny and his sidekick Sal have a plan to rob a Brooklyn bank. The novice crooks thought they would be in and out in 10 minutes, but instead find themselves stuck in an ongoing hostage situation, with the police and the media laying siege to the bank. Sidney Lumet's fact-based drama, starring Al Pacino, John Cazale and Charles Durning.

programme.title: One Hour Photo
programme.desc: A lonely photo technician develops an increasing obsession with a seemingly perfect couple and their child, whose pictures he processes - but when he uncovers evidence of marital infidelity, he resolves to expose the truth, regardless of the cost. Psychological thriller, starring Robin Williams, Connie Nielsen, Michael Vartan, Gary Cole and Dylan Smith.

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: A troubled philosophy professor begins teaching at a small town college, but struggles to find any meaning in his life. He finds some measure of happiness in his friendship with a student, and when they overhear a stranger's conversation, it spurs the tortured academic on to a course of action that changes everything. Woody Allen's drama, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone and Parker Posey.

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Biopic of hip hop group NWA, examining their rise to fame in the 1980s. The five members of the group drew inspiration from their anger at the dangerous world they saw around them, producing hard-hitting songs about urban life that redefined a musical genre. Starring O'Shea Jackson Jr, Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell, Neil Brown Jr and Aldis Hodge.

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: An inexperienced financial trader is taken under the wing of a corrupt New York corporate raider, who draws him into the shady world of illegal insider dealing with promises of money and power. But the trainee stockbroker questions the morality of his actions when the consequences of a deal strike close to home. Oliver Stone's Oscar-winning drama, starring Michael Douglas, father and son Martin and Charlie Sheen, Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp.

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: An Elvis-obsessed ex-con and his lover set off on a nightmarish journey across America pursued by a variety of bizarre and deadly characters. David Lynch's dark road movie, starring Nicolas Cage, Laura Dern, Diane Ladd, Willem Dafoe, Harry Dean Stanton and Isabella Rossellini.(n)

programme.title: The Devils
programme.desc: A sexually liberated priest in 17th-century France attracts the hatred of the King and the church with his radical views. When an obsessed nun accuses him of witchcraft, the cleric's enemies strike, using increasingly brutal tactics in their efforts to prove him a heretic. Ken Russell's historical drama, starring Oliver Reed and Vanessa Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: Johnny Guitar
programme.desc: Saloon manager Vienna opens a casino in readiness for the boomtown days expected when the railroad arrives in town. A hard-nosed female rancher plans to stop her from attracting unwanted settlers onto her land, so Vienna hires a gunslinger for protection. Western, starring Joan Crawford, Mercedes McCambridge, Sterling Hayden and Ernest Borgnine.(n)

programme.title: March of the Penguins
programme.desc: Luc Jacquet's Oscar-winning nature documentary follows a colony of emperor penguins on a journey hundreds of miles across the Antarctic ice to reach their breeding grounds, enduring harsh weather conditions and freezing temperatures along the way. Once they have mated, the males stay to guard the eggs while the females return to the sea to gather food. Narrated by Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A Russian mob boss sets up a profitable real-estate scam in London and soon every criminal in the city is after their share. The gangster's accountant hires a trio of crooks to take his boss's millions, while a rock star with a penchant for faking his own death causes further mayhem by stealing a valuable painting. Guy Ritchie's crime comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton.(n)

programme.title: The Salvation
programme.desc: A Danish settler in the Wild West is joined by his wife and son, but they are soon murdered. He avenges their deaths, but his actions attract the wrath of a ruthless gang leader. Abandoned by his friends and neighbours, the peaceful pioneer is forced to stand alone to enforce the law in his new home. Western, starring Mads Mikkelsen and Eva Green.(n)

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Straight-shooting peacemakers Everett and Virgil try to restore order in a town under the control of crooked rancher Randall and his murderous gang. However, the pair find their friendship threatened by the arrival of attractive widow Allison, who leads Virgil to question his nomadic existence. Western, starring Ed Harris, Viggo Mortensen, Jeremy Irons and Renee Zellweger.(n)

programme.title: Inherent Vice
programme.desc: A drug addled private detective unwittingly becomes embroiled in an elaborate kidnapping case in Los Angeles during the 1970s involving an old flame, her billionaire boyfriend and his wife. Comedy drama based on Thomas Pynchon's acclaimed novel, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Josh Brolin and Reese Witherspoon.(n)

programme.title: Million Dollar Baby
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck boxing coach nurses a grudge because his best fighter has abandoned him for the big time. When a 31-year-old waitress turns up asking him to train her, he refuses outright. However, her persistence wins him round and the pair go on to form a strong professional partnership and successful career. Oscar-winning drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, alongside Hilary Swank, Morgan Freeman and Anthony Mackie.(n)

programme.title: Hustle & Flow
programme.desc: A pimp and drug pusher decides to change his ways after reaching the age at which his father died. Using his experience of life on the streets, he becomes a rapper, and an encounter with a local hip-hop star gives him the perfect chance to begin his career in music. Drama, starring Terrence Howard, Anthony Anderson, Taryn Manning and Isaac Hayes.(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A Russian mob boss sets up a profitable real-estate scam in London and soon every criminal in the city is after their share. The gangster's accountant hires a trio of crooks to take his boss's millions, while a rock star with a penchant for faking his own death causes further mayhem by stealing a valuable painting. Guy Ritchie's crime comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton.(n)

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: An unlicensed boxing promoter and his dim-witted sidekick convince an Irish gypsy to step in for their injured fighter, but find themselves drawn into a match-fixing racket. Meanwhile, the loot from a diamond heist goes missing, leading to a bloody conflict between Russian gangsters and a Jewish mob. Guy Ritchie's comedy drama, with Jason Statham, Brad Pitt, Benicio Del Toro and Stephen Graham.(n)

programme.title: Potiche
programme.desc: A factory owner rules his business and his family with an iron fist, but is stripped of all power when his workforce goes on strike and holds him hostage. His trophy wife takes over running things in his absence and proves herself a talented businesswoman, creating tension when her husband hopes to take up the reins again. Comedy, starring Catherine Deneuve and Gerard Depardieu. In French.

programme.title: Summer Holiday
programme.desc: Four mechanics embark on a fun-filled trip across Europe on board a double-decker London bus, and enjoy all manner of romantic adventures with three young women who hitch a ride on their way to Athens. However, an unexpected stowaway causes a few surprises. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Lauri Peters, Melvyn Hayes, Una Stubbs, Ron Moody and the Shadows.

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
programme.desc: A boy starts a new school determined to be popular and admired, only to find himself instead a target for bullies. He documents his experiences in a journal as he sets out on a series of attempts to gain the respect he feels he deserves - but his every effort ends in disaster. Family comedy, with Zachary Gordon, Robert Capron and Chloe Grace Moretz.

programme.title: Imagine That
programme.desc: A financial executive finds his once successful career beginning to fall apart. He finds solutions to his problems when he enters the imaginary world created by his daughter - but the experience also makes him rethink whether the benefits of his job outweigh the drawbacks. Fantasy comedy, with Eddie Murphy, Yara Shahidi, Thomas Haden Church and Martin Sheen.

programme.title: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Sid the sloth discovers three eggs - but when they hatch into dinosaurs, he struggles to keep them under control. The creatures' mother comes looking for her offspring and takes them and Sid to an underground world where the giant reptiles never became extinct. Sid's friends, aided by a crazed one-eyed weasel, head for this strange new land to rescue him. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, Ray Romano and Simon Pegg.

programme.title: Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters
programme.desc: The modern-day teenage son of the Greek god Poseidon must lead his friends on a perilous journey into the Bermuda triangle. They need to recover the legendary Golden Fleece to save the world, but getting to it means braving all manner of terrifying monsters. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Logan Lerman and Alexandra Daddario.

programme.title: Unknown
programme.desc: A doctor on a business trip in Germany ends up in a coma after a car accident. He wakes up to find another man is claiming to be him, his wife does not recognise him and any evidence of his real identity has disappeared. He seeks the help of the woman who saved his life as he tries to find out what has happened. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Diane Kruger and January Jones.

programme.title: Filth
programme.desc: A corrupt policeman with a cocaine habit plans to advance his own career by turning colleagues against each other, while also desperately hoping to persuade his ex-wife to take him back. He rapidly loses his grip on reality as the drug use spirals out of control and his web of lies grows increasingly complex. Black comedy, starring James McAvoy, Imogen Poots, Jamie Bell and Jim Broadbent.

programme.title: Wild Things
programme.desc: A high-school counsellor is accused of rape by a student whose advances he spurned - and unfortunately for him, one of her peers backs up her story. Thriller, starring Neve Campbell, Denise Richards, Matt Dillon, Kevin Bacon, Theresa Russell, Robert Wagner and Bill Murray.(n)

programme.title: Picture Perfect
programme.desc: An ambitious executive hires a man to pose as her fiance to give her a stable image at work and attract a colleague who is only tempted by unavailable women. However, her fantasy life soon spirals out of control, leaving her unable to tell the difference between fact and fiction. Romantic comedy, with Jennifer Aniston, Jay Mohr, Kevin Bacon, Olympia Dukakis and Illeana Douglas.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Continental Drift
programme.desc: A cataclysm leaves prehistoric animals Manny, Sid and Diego lost at sea on a drifting iceberg. They try to find a way to return home, embarking on a journey that leads to an encounter with a ferocious band of piratical creatures. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ray Romano, John Leguizamo, Denis Leary and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Fast Girls
programme.desc: A fierce rivalry develops between a talented working class sprinter and the wealthy daughter of a former Olympic medal-winner as they compete on the track. They are forced to settle their differences and work together when they are recruited for the same relay team. Drama, with Lenora Crichlow, Lily James, Rupert Graves and Noel Clarke, who also co-wrote the script.(n)

programme.title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off
programme.desc: A cocky teenager plays truant from school and spends the day dragging his girlfriend and a reluctant friend into all manner of crazy adventures in the big city - while the school's dean of students vows to stop at nothing to prove the youngster is faking illness. Comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Mia Sara, Alan Ruck, Jennifer Grey, Jeffrey Jones and Charlie Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The Three Musketeers
programme.desc: A hot-headed swordsman sets off to join the King of France's royal guard, and falls in with a trio of former members who have fallen into disgrace. They join forces to defeat a plot to overthrow the king by an English lord who has built a deadly airship. Swashbuckling adventure, with Logan Lerman, Milla Jovovich, Matthew Macfadyen, Ray Stevenson and Luke Evans.(n)

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: A corporation that creates military robots seizes a chance to diversify into law enforcement when a Detroit cop is critically injured in a bombing. He is rebuilt as a crime-fighting cyborg, but struggles to regain his free will from his creators' control. Sci-fi thriller remake, starring Joel Kinnaman, Gary Oldman, Michael Keaton and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: The Treatment
programme.desc: Premiere. Police inspector Nick Cafmeyer investigates the abduction of a 10-year-old boy and the horrific ordeal the perpetrator inflicted upon the boy's parents while snatching their son. As events unfold, he begins to suspect the crime could be connected to the disappearance of his own brother, who was taken from his family at a similar age and never seen again. Belgian thriller, starring Geert Van Rampelberg. In Flemish.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A newcomer arrives in town looking for a job and a place to stay, but suspicions are raised that he may be a German spy.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob and Ben are consumed with jealousy as each would rather be with the other's girlfriend. Mamie Baldwin realises she may not have long left to live.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: If I Should Wake Before I Die.
programme.desc: Amy decides to fake her own death to trick her estranged family into coming to town.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura befriends a girl with a deformed leg, but when Charles offers to help the youngster walk more easily, her father objects.

programme.title: For Love of Olivia
programme.desc: A small-town lawyer running for congress is blackmailed into defending a man accused of murder - and to make matters worse, his wife is harbouring a shocking secret. Thriller, starring Louis Gossett Jr, Robert Urich and Lonette McKee.

programme.title: Video Voyeur: The Susan Wilson Story
programme.desc: A woman is understandably horrified to discover her apparently kind-hearted neighbour has somehow managed to install state-of-the-art surveillance equipment throughout her home, so he can spy on her and her family. Fact-based drama, starring Angie Harmon, Jamey Sheridan and Dale Midkiff.

programme.title: I Heard the Owl Call My Name
programme.desc: A terminally ill priest is sent by his bishop to be minister to a Native Canadian coastal village. He becomes accepted into their community, and as he witnesses its gradual destruction, gains the strength to face his own fate without fear. Drama based on Margaret Craven's novel, starring Tom Courtenay and Dean Jagger.

programme.title: No One Could Protect Her
programme.desc: A woman is raped in her own home, but the police seem powerless to apprehend the attacker. As reports of further sexual assaults in her neighbourhood mount up, all seemingly the work of the same man, she resolves to turn detective and bring him to justice herself. Thriller based on a true story, starring Joanna Kerns, Anthony John Denison and Peter MacNeill.

programme.title: A Killing in a Small Town
programme.desc: A Sunday school teacher looking for excitement embarks on an affair with a church-going man, leading to a fatal confrontation with his wife - but as the case goes to trial, she realises the odds are stacked against a jury accepting her plea of self-defence. Fact-based drama, starring Barbara Hershey, Brian Dennehy, John Terry and Lee Garlington.

programme.title: Her Desperate Choice
programme.desc: A woman flees the authorities in an attempt to protect her daughter from the child's paedophile father and seeks the help of an underground organisation dedicated to protecting abused youngsters. Drama, with Kyle Secor, Faith Ford, Hanna R Hall and Nigel Bennett.

programme.title: Prophet of Evil: The Ervil LeBaron Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, about religious fanatic Ervil LeBaron, who believed he had God's permission to kill anyone standing in the way of his drive for wealth and power. Starring Brian Dennehy, Tracy Needham and William Devane.

programme.title: In the Line of Duty: The Price of Vengeance
programme.desc: A tough-talking hitman sets out to bump off a quartet of local businessman who stand in his way - but he decides to do away with a hard-nosed cop into the bargain, a decision that makes him the target of a furious vendetta. Crime thriller, starring Dean Stockwell, Michael Gross and Brent Jennings.

programme.title: Prison of Secrets
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a new convict in a women's prison, who struggles to expose a corrupt system under which guards demand sexual favours from her fellow inmates. Stephanie Zimbalist, Finola Hughes and Gary Frank star.

programme.title: Passion and Prejudice
programme.desc: A professor hires a convicted criminal to work for her as part of a prison work programme, and the pair soon embark on a passionate affair. However, when he is finally released, he tries to put the past behind him - something she cannot allow him to do. Romantic drama, starring Frances Fisher, Derwin Jordan and Kandyse McClure.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason works with a black boy on an act for the spring festival, but is shocked by the racial prejudice he encounters. Elizabeth has a crush on a new boy in her class.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The children prepare a surprise party for John and Olivia's 25th wedding anniversary, while their parents have surprises of their own in store.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles takes Caroline on a second honeymoon, but she cannot stop worrying about how things are back home.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Miss Beadle is injured and ordered to rest by Doc Baker, so Caroline takes over as substitute teacher of Walnut Grove School. During her tenure, an uneducated youth named Abel McKay enrolls, and is relentlessly teased because of his illiteracy.(n)

programme.title: Desperate Rescue
programme.desc: A Jordanian man kidnaps his seven-year-old daughter and takes her back to his native country, prompting his ex-wife to enlist the aid of a crack anti-terrorist squad in a bid to steal the child back. Thriller, starring Mariel Hemingway, Jeff Kober, James Russo and Clancy Brown.(n)

programme.title: Ride to Freedom: The Rosa Parks Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the life of Rosa Parks, the black woman who famously refused to give up her seat on a bus to a white man in 1950s America. The action prompted a massive outpouring of anger and sparked the rise of the civil rights movement. Angela Bassett, Cicely Tyson and Peter Francis James star.(n)

programme.title: Returning Lily
programme.desc: An unhappily married woman receives news that the woman who raised her has died, and decides to fulfil her last wish by taking her ashes to Hawaii. On her arrival she becomes attracted to the dead woman's nephew, and also realises her mother, whom she has never met, is living on the island. Drama, starring Virginia Madsen, Lainie Kazan and Jason Mamoa.(n)

programme.title: Guilty Hearts
programme.desc: Part one of two. Fact-based crime drama about an Illinois man who murders his wife in order to be with his mistress. Treat Williams, Marcia Gay Harden and Gary Basaraba star.(n)

programme.title: A Killing in a Small Town
programme.desc: A Sunday school teacher looking for excitement embarks on an affair with a church-going man, leading to a fatal confrontation with his wife - but as the case goes to trial, she realises the odds are stacked against a jury accepting her plea of self-defence. Fact-based drama, starring Barbara Hershey, Brian Dennehy, John Terry and Lee Garlington.(n)

programme.title: Prison of Secrets
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a new convict in a women's prison, who struggles to expose a corrupt system under which guards demand sexual favours from her fellow inmates. Stephanie Zimbalist, Finola Hughes and Gary Frank star.(n)

programme.title: Jack Reed: One of Our Own
programme.desc: The maverick detective's partner is murdered by a hitman they were investigating and he sets out to bring him to justice with the help of the killer's girlfriend. Thriller, directed by and starring Brian Dennehy. With Susan Ruttan, Charles Dutton and CCH Pounder.(n)

programme.title: Shadow of a Doubt
programme.desc: A washed-up alcoholic former lawyer is persuaded to return to the courtroom by an ex-lover, whose daughter is charged with murder. He agrees to take on the case, but finds himself at the centre of the media circus as the prosecution uses his drink problem to undermine his credibility. Courtroom drama, starring Brian Dennehy, Bonnie Bedelia and Fairuza Balk.(n)

programme.title: Prophet of Evil: The Ervil LeBaron Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, about religious fanatic Ervil LeBaron, who believed he had God's permission to kill anyone standing in the way of his drive for wealth and power. Starring Brian Dennehy, Tracy Needham and William Devane.(n)

programme.title: I Am Slave
programme.desc: Wunmi Mosaku stars in the story of one woman's fight for freedom from modern-day slavery. Twelve-year-old Malia is snatched from her home in the Numa Mountains, Sudan, and spends the next six years of her life working for a Sudanese family. At the age of 18 she is sent to London, where she is stripped of her passport and subjected to brutality and inhumanity, until she calls on all her strength to plan an escape back to the father who never stopped searching for her. Drama inspired by real-life events, with Lubna Azabal and Igal Naor.(n)

programme.title: Till Murder Do Us Part
programme.desc: Two-part drama. A woman is humiliated at being dragged through divorce proceedings by her husband and decides murder is the only suitable form of revenge. Starring Meredith Baxter, Stephen Collins and Michelle Johnson.

programme.title: Kids Don't Tell
programme.desc: A film-maker works on a documentary about the sexual abuse of children, but finds his wife increasingly distant toward him. He eventually discovers she was a victim of molestation in her own childhood, a secret she has kept from everyone. Drama, starring Michael Ontkean and Jobeth Williams.

programme.title: A Dangerous Affair
programme.desc: A high-flying career woman thinks she has met the man of her dreams - until he reveals his true colours by subjecting her to a cruel campaign of obsessive stalking and torment. Thriller, starring Connie Sellecca, Gregory Harrison and Christopher Meloni.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A girl befriended by the family is shocked to learn her drunken father was responsible for burning down the school to prevent Miss Hunter teaching the theory of evolution.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy falls for Jenny Pendleton, who has run away from her home in Richmond and taken refuge on Walton's Mountain, but his romantic bliss proves short-lived.

programme.title: A Touch of Hope
programme.desc: A man discovers he has the abilities of a faith healer. Initially reluctant, he agrees to use his gift to help doctors, but only in emergency cases. However, many in the medical community are suspicious of his claims, a conflict that comes to a head when he is asked to bring a doubting doctor's daughter out of a coma. Fact-based drama, starring Anthony Michael Hall, CCH Pounder, Abraham Benrubi and Fay Masterson.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Remembrance
programme.desc: A woman struggles to confront the facts behind her mother's murder, including a doomed love affair cut short by the horrors of the Korean War, and a passionate relationship with a high-flying photographer who hides a dark secret. Drama, starring Angie Dickinson, Eva LaRue and Jeffrey Nordling.

programme.title: Someone Else's Child
programme.desc: Fact-based drama charting the tragic consequences of a maternity unit mix-up. A woman is distressed to discover she is not the biological mother of the seven-year-old she has brought up. She sets out to win custody of her real son, with traumatic consequences. Starring Lisa Hartman, Bruce Davison and Louise Fletcher.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason helps Verdie investigate her family history, while Elizabeth writes to a soldier serving in the war - but she tells him she is 18 and sends him a picture of Erin.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mrs Oleson's prejudice and hatred makes a former circus dwarf's life a misery when he moves to Walnut Groove. Billy Barty guest stars.

programme.title: Prophet of Evil: The Ervil LeBaron Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, about religious fanatic Ervil LeBaron, who believed he had God's permission to kill anyone standing in the way of his drive for wealth and power. Starring Brian Dennehy, Tracy Needham and William Devane.

programme.title: Her Desperate Choice
programme.desc: A woman flees the authorities in an attempt to protect her daughter from the child's paedophile father and seeks the help of an underground organisation dedicated to protecting abused youngsters. Drama, with Kyle Secor, Faith Ford, Hanna R Hall and Nigel Bennett.

programme.title: Prince William and Prince Harry: The Next Royal Generation
programme.desc: Profile of the two princes, examining what the future holds for the royal family.

programme.title: The New Royals
programme.desc: The role played by the younger members of the royal family, most notably Prince William, in a society increasingly obsessed with celebrities.

programme.title: Visions of Terror
programme.desc: A police psychologist begins counselling a traumatised cop whose partner died in the line of duty, and soon realises there is more to the case than meets the eye. Crime drama, starring Barbara Eden, Ted Marcoux and David Marciano.

programme.title: Till Murder Do Us Part
programme.desc: Two-part drama. A woman is humiliated at being dragged through divorce proceedings by her husband and decides murder is the only suitable form of revenge. Starring Meredith Baxter, Stephen Collins and Michelle Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Children
programme.desc: Part one of two. Fact-based drama about Orphaned Jewish children from across Europe fleeing the Holocaust, who find a hiding place in an Italian villa. With Ken Duken. In Italian.(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's A Secret Affair
programme.desc: An American woman breaks off her engagement to begin a new life with a journalist, but unfortunately her lover disappears while on a reporting assignment in Serbia. Drama adapted from Barbara Taylor Bradford's novel, starring Janine Turner, Fionnula Flanagan and Robert Mailhouse.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia's timid uncle Cody Nelson pays a visit to the family after losing his job in a bank, and John-Boy and Grandpa set out to find him a wife. However, he falls in love with Cordelia Hunnicutt, who has been married four times already, much to the disapproval of Olivia and Grandma.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy offers shelter to a gypsy couple with a sick child, but is shocked by the reaction of the rest of his family.(n)

programme.title: The Unspoken Truth
programme.desc: A woman marries a dangerously volatile man, who one night shoots a man in a fit of rage. He forces her to claim she shot the man by accident, a lie which leaves her facing a life sentence and the possibility of losing her daughter. Fact-based drama, starring Lea Thompson, James Marshall, Patricia Kalember and Robert Englund.(n)

programme.title: Mistaken Identity
programme.desc: A mix-up in a maternity ward results in two new mothers unwittingly taking home the wrong babies - leaving them to face a terrible dilemma once the truth comes to light. Drama based on a true story, starring Melissa Gilbert, Rosanna Arquette, David Andrews and James McCaffrey.(n)

programme.title: The Heroes of Desert Storm
programme.desc: Drama, based on the first Gulf War, as seen through the eyes of the men and women involved. Starring Angela Bassett, Daniel Baldwin and Kevin Kilner.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's A Perfect Stranger
programme.desc: A woman resigned to nursing her bedridden husband is swept off her feet by a handsome stranger and soon realises she is falling in love - but guilt and responsibility get the better of her. Romantic drama, starring Stacy Haiduk, Robert Urich and Darren McGavin.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Fine Things
programme.desc: A man marries the woman of his dreams, only to see her die of cancer - and while coping with the pain of bereavement, he finds himself subjected to extortionate demands from her drug-dealing ex-husband. Drama, starring DW Moffett, Tracy Pollan and Cloris Leachman.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Changes
programme.desc: Two single parents, a successful journalist and a wealthy, widowed heart surgeon, fall in love and rush headlong into marriage. However, the move proves to have far-reaching consequences for them and their children. Romantic drama, starring Cheryl Ladd, Michael Nouri and Christopher Gartin.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Full Circle
programme.desc: A rape victim struggles to overcome the trauma of her ordeal and learn to trust men again, without succumbing to her mother's cynical outlook on life. Drama, starring Jennifer Barker, Teri Polo, Corbin Bernsen, Eric Lutes, Reed Diamond and Erika Slezak.(n)

programme.title: The Last Don

Kirstie Alley, Daryl Hannah and Joe Mantegna also star, with an appearance by singer kd lang.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: In his breakthrough Hollywood role, Robin Williams stars in Barry Levinson's black comedy as DJ Adrian Cronauer, assigned to the US Armed Services Radio station in Vietnam. His outrageous quip-laden, cynical broadcasting style, matched by his choice of records, immediately lands him in hot water with the top brass but his popularity with the soldiers in the field saves his bacon. But as the war comes closer to home (he barely survives a bomb attack) and he becomes involved with a Vietnam girlfriend, he is forced to take both himself and the war a little more seriously(n)

programme.desc: The Host and Mother director Bong Joon-ho makes his English-language debut with this dystopian sci-fi thriller set in the aftermath of a failed global-warming experiment that ushered in the dawn of a new Ice Age. As a perpetual-motion engine keeps a super-powered locomotive speeding around the planet, the impoverished lower classes occupy the rear cars while the privileged upper classes are pampered in the front. The fragile balance of power between the two begins to shift, however, when an enigmatic message sparks a revolt that cannot be quelled. Luke Evans, Song Kang-ho, Jamie Bell, John Hurt, Tilda Swinton, and Ed Harris star(n)

programme.title: Ticks
programme.desc: A group of inner city teenagers are taken on a trip into the wilderness by a social worker and her boyfriend. There they have to contend with mutated ticks that have an appetite for human flesh

programme.title: Wolves

programme.title: Judgment Day
programme.desc: Captivating sci-fi yarn revolves around a doomsday scenario involving an FBI agent (Suzy Amis) who springs a convicted killer (Ice-T) from jail to help save a scientist kidnapped by a religious cult. Mario Van Peebles

programme.title: The Day
programme.desc: A small band of friends make an uneasy alliance with a mysterious lone wolf in this blend of horror and adventure. An unnamed catastrophe has turned the Earth into a wasteland, and as packs of feral cannibals wander the countryside, a dwindling number of survivors struggle to stay alive. Rick (Dominic Monaghan), Adam (Shawn Ashmore), Henson (Cory Hardrict), and Shannon (Shannyn Sossamon) have been journeying together for months and are the last living members of a much larger group. Mary (Ashley Bell) is a solitary woman who crossed paths with the survivors and is now traveling with them. She isn't interested in discussing her past or becoming friends, but the others learn she's a powerful ally in a fight. The travelers take shelter in a house, but are soon surrounded by cannibals; they quickly realize just how strong a warrior Mary can be, while also discovering the terrible truth that led her to wander alone. The Day was directed by Douglas Aarniokoski, who has accumulated extensive credits as an assistant director and helming second-unit material on major films

programme.title: Frank Miller's Sin City: A Dame to Kill For
programme.desc: The follow-up to the comic miniseries adaptation, tells Dwight's backstory as he becomes wrapped up in the thralls of femme fatale, Ava. Elsewhere in the seedy city, a mysterious gambler is set on taking down his sworn enemy in a high-stakes game of life and death

programme.title: Wolves
programme.desc: A high schooler discovers he's a werewolf after his parents are savagely murdered. He later ends up in a remote mountain town, where he meets others of his kind and fights for the love of a beautiful woman

programme.title: Reeker
programme.desc: Five students driving through the desert encounter the inescapable stench of death in director David Payne's retro-inspired slasher/monster/supernatural horror hybrid. The highway has been inexplicably closed, forcing five young travelers into a mysteriously abandoned travel oasis where they are soon confronted with disturbing visions of maimed travelers. Disturbed by the grisly series of visions and determined to escape the spooky motel and diner before whatever killed the previous customers returns, the frightened travelers soon meet a frantic stranger who claims to have recently lost his wife to a terrifying entity that seems to hover between life and death. As the night falls, a blind grad student with heightened senses proves the only hope for survival as the body count begins to rise and the smell of death becomes too suffocating to endure(n)

programme.title: The Last Survivors
programme.desc: An officer mulls sacrificing passengers on an overcrowded lifeboat in order to prevent the vessel from foundering(n)

programme.title: The Roost
programme.desc: Creatures of the night find new prey on the scariest night of the year in this horror story. It's Halloween night, and four friends -- Allison (Vanessa Horneff), Elliott (Wil Horneff), Trevor (Karl Jacob), and Brian (Sean Reid) -- are on a road trip en route to a friend's wedding when their car breaks down after running into something. Looking for help, the four happen upon the farmhouse of an elderly couple, Elvin (Richard Little) and May (Barbara Wilhide), which is located next to a huge barn. Elvin and May have already become lost in the darkness of the barn, and soon two of the lost travelers are suffering the same fate as they search for friendly strangers. However, while they can barely see a hand in front of their face, they discover they're not alone in the barn, which has become home to a huge swarm of bloodthirsty bats. The Roost is framed by an introduction and postscript from a television horror show host, played by Tom Noonan(n)

programme.desc: The hip-hop underworld erupts into violence after Super Star Records' top recording artist is gunned down in the prime of his career, and the tragic death helps to launch his best friend to super stardom. Before long, the deceased star's former best friend Rod (Fredro Star) is dodging bullets, too, but remarkably his close brushes with death only serve to spurn on his popularity. programme.title: Holy Man
programme.desc: Stephen Herek directed this comedy-drama in which soul-less exec Ricky Hayman (Jeff Goldblum), programmer for the failing Good Buy Shopping Network, is dismayed by a request to increase sales in two weeks. Bald do-gooder guru G. (Eddie Murphy) assists when Ricky and marketing director Kate (Kelly Preston) get a freeway flat. When G. passes out, tests indicate a heart murmur and heat prostration, so the robed prophet becomes Ricky's house guest. At a party, G. uses hypnosis and psychology to rid guest Nino Cerruti (portraying himself) of his flying fears. Ricky witnesses this and gets the notion to put G. on the air. Unfortunately, G. ignores both cue cards and on-sale products, prompting station owner McBainbridge (Robert Loggia) to calculate Ricky's severance pay. He's back on the job when both sales and ratings soar. The situation eventually causes Ricky to reexamine how his own values became lost in the labyrinth of corporate consumerism(n)

programme.title: Knuckleball!

The pitch entails lobbing the baseball in such a way that it doesn't rotate, and therefore moves in a manner that's impossible to predict. The filmmakers follow Tim Wakefield and R.A. Dickey, the only two knuckleball pitchers in the majors during the 2011 season, as they attempt to stay in the big leagues while relying on this unorthodox weapon(n)

programme.title: Duets
programme.desc: Director Bruce Paltrow teams with his Oscar-winning daughter Gwyneth Paltrow for this road comedy with music. Paltrow plays Liv, a struggling professional singer whose meets her father, Ricky Dean (Huey Lewis), for the first time at the funeral of her mother. As it turns out, both Liv and Ricky supplement the income from few-and-far-between gigs by singing in karaoke contests, and soon father and daughter are competing on the same circuit. Meanwhile, Todd Woods (Paul Giamatti), a salesman who has grown disenchanted with his job, his family, and his life, picks up a hitch-hiker named Reggie Kane (Andre Braugher), and during a stop at a tavern, they discover they make a good duet team while belting out a version of "Try A Little Tenderness." And waitress Suzi Loomis (Maria Bello) sweet talks Billy (Scott Speedman), a cabbie, into driving her to Omaha, where the national karaoke finals will determine who does the best job of singing along with the records, as the lives of these six characters begin to intersect. Duets also features Angie Dickinson as Blair, Liv's grandmother who was once a showgirl in Frank Sinatra's Las Vegas floorshow; Brad Pitt was originally cast in Speedman's role but withdrew after he and Paltrow announced the end of their off-camera relationship(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mom and Pop Art. After seeing a commercial for a do-it-yourself Barbecue Pit Kit, Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) tries building one himself, but the end result is a useless and unrecognizable mass of brick, mortal and metal. Homer has no luck returning it to the hardware store, but when the object is found by Astrid Weller (voice of Isabella Rossellini), proprietor of the "Louvre: American Style" art gallery, she presumes it's a sculpture by a gifted outsider artist, and puts it on display. When capricious multi-billionaire C. Montgomery Burns (voice of Harry Shearer) buys the piece, Homer is officially a professional artist, and he quits his job to work up more sculptures for his first show. Marge (voice of Julie Kavner), herself a talented artist, is a bit peeved that her husband has been proclaimed a genius by Springfield's intelligencia over a botched attempt at masonry, but Homer's one man show lands with a resounding thud, and Homer decides he needs to come up with a major project if the creative community is to continue to respect him. "Mom and Pop Art" first aired on April 11, 1999, and features a voice cameo from acclaimed artist Jasper Johns

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Kristen Stewart stars in Catherine Hardwicke's adaptation of Stephenie Meyer's best-selling series of romantic fantasy novels about a teenage girl who falls in love with a vampire. When her mother remarries, Bella Swan moves to Washington State to live with her father Charlie. There, in the small, perpetually wintry town of Forks, she starts her new life, though she has no inkling of quite how different it's going to be. At her new school she quickly establishes herself as both a bit of a klutz and a hunk magnet. But she's not interested in most of the guys, apart from the moodily handsome, ashen complexioned Edward Cullen. And when he saves her from various threatening situations, their mutual attraction is sealed. There's just one problem he's a vampire. But although Edward and his undead family are 'vegetarians' who don't feed on humans, his breed find it very difficult to control their overwhelming desire for human blood when their emotions switch from love to lust..(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: Catherine Hardwicke hands on the directorial baton to Chris Weitz for this second part of the cinematic adaptation of Stephenie Meyer's teen vampire saga. The chapter opens with Bella Swan (Kristen Stewart) on the cusp of her 18th birthday and blissfully happy with her undead beau Edward Cullen. But, while she's celebrating her birthday with Edward's family of 'vegetarian' vampires, a frightening incident convinces Edward that he's simply too dangerous to be around his sweetheart. He leaves the town of Forks in order to ensure her safety - leaving her behind, angry and depressed. Bella finds some relief from her emotional numbness through recklessly riding motorbikes and succumbing to the attentions of her friend Jacob Black. But he is also a supernatural being, and not one with a natural affinity to vampires..(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse

programme.title: Barbershop
programme.desc: Calvin (Ice Cube) never wanted to take over the family business, a barbershop on the south side of Chicago. Disgusted with the shop's crime-ridden neighborhood, and caught up in his moneymaking schemes, one morning Calvin decides to sell the shop to the shady Lester (Keith David). Chastised by his pregnant wife, Jennifer (Jazsmin Lewis), for his rash decision, Calvin spends the day cutting heads at the shop, and starts to understand the importance of the legacy his grandfather and father have left to him. The bickering barbers include Eddie (Cedric the Entertainer), the old-timer with his own unique perspective on black life; Terri (rapper Eve in her film debut), a hot-tempered woman with a trifling boyfriend; Jimmy (Sean Patrick Thomas), a college educated snob; Ricky (Michael Ealy) a reformed criminal; Isaac (Troy Garity, the son of Jane Fonda and Tom Hayden), a white B-Boy, whom no one is ready to let cut their hair; and Dinka (Leonard Howze), a recent African immigrant who's too shy to express his feelings for Terri. Calvin learns to appreciate them all, and discovers that the place where they work is more than just a place to get a haircut -- it's a meeting place for the neighborhood, a place where folks can speak their minds and find out what's happening. Calvin gradually changes his mind about selling the shop, but it may be too late. Meanwhile, a bumbling thief, J.D. (Anthony Anderson) spends a painful day trying to crack open the ATM he's stolen from the grocery store across the street. Barbershop was directed by Tim Story and produced by George Tillman Jr. and Robert Teitel, the producers of Soul Food. Barbershop had its world premiere at the 2002 Urbanworld Film Festival

programme.title: Beauty Shop
programme.desc: Gina Norris is a long way from the Barbershop - she's moved from Chicago to Atlanta so her daughter can attend a prestigious music school, and she's made a name for herself at a posh salon with her cutting-edge hairstyles. But when her egotistical boss takes credit for her work, she leaves the salon with the shampoo girl in tow to open a shop of her own. Gina buys a rundown salon and inherits a motley group of headstrong stylists, a colorful clientele, and a sexy piano-playing electrician. It's a rocky road to fulfilling her dreams, but you can't keep a good woman down

programme.title: Happily N'Ever After
programme.desc: Cinderella's wicked stepmother has tipped the balance of power toward the dark side in Fairy Tale Land, and now it's up to the put-upon princess to restore order and ensure that good triumphs in an animated adventure featuring the voices of Sarah Michelle Gellar, Freddie Prinze Jr., Sigourney Weaver, and George Carlin. For years, the Wise Wizard has worked hard to ensure that the scales of good and evil were always well-balanced, but as with any hard worker the Wise Wizard needs a relaxing vacation every once in a while. When the Wise Wizard goes on holiday, his faithful assistants Munk and Mambo make the crucial mistake of allowing Cinderella's wicked stepmother, Frieda, come into possession of their master's magical staff. With time fast running out before Frieda casts a shadow of darkness and sorrow over Fairy Tale Land, Cinderella must now awaken from her romantic dreams to take on her fearsome stepmother with a little help from her best friend, Rick, and a virtual army of heroic dwarves and fairies(n)

She and her sister's band are catapulted into global superstardom, but their newfound fame threatens to break apart their familial bonds when a record executive (Juliette Lewis) meddles in their affairs. This spirited musical fantasy directed by Jon M. Chu is adapted from the 1980s animated series Jem(n)

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: Michael Bay's all-action adventure, based on the popular toy. Earth becomes the battleground between the good Transformers and the bad who are searching for the all-powerful Allspark which could destroy humanity. Caught up in the middle is Sam Witwicky, whose beaten-up old car reveals itself to be an Autobot called Bumblebee. The duo hold the key to the battle which rages between the Decepticons and the government forces, led by Sgt Lennox but can they stop the evil Megatron(r)

programme.title: Pathfinder
programme.desc: The sole survivor of a Viking "dragon" vessel shipwrecked on the eastern shores of the New World 15 years ago provides the only hope for the a Native American tribe faced with certain destruction by Norse berserkers in director Marcus Nispel's (The Texas Chainsaw Massacre) dark action adventure. Reared by the Wampanoag tribe following a failed attempt by the Vikings to raid coastal villages for slaves, a ten-year-old shipwreck survivor is nicknamed "Ghost" by his adoptive tribe due to his pale complexion and blond hair. Legend says that death and destruction will follow the boy wherever he travels, yet the peaceful people of the Wampanoag tribe selflessly take the frightened child in as if he is one of their own. Over the course of the following decade, the adopted young Norseman eventually grows into a strong warrior (Karl Urban) determined to prove his worth to the people he calls family. When the rampaging Vikings return to the New World to rain destruction down on the Native Americans and to claim the fertile land of the peaceful people, Ghost finds himself in the precarious position of having to stop his own people from destroying his village and ruthlessly slaughtering the woman he loves (Moon Bloodgood). Now, as Ghost's true destiny is revealed by the powerful shaman known as the Pathfinder (Russell Means), the fearless warrior sets out to stage a savage one-man war on the marauding Vikings and become the savior once prophesied to defend the Wampanoag people in their darkest hour

programme.title: Magic Mike
programme.desc: Steven Soderbergh's Magic Mike stars Channing Tatum as the title character, an entrepreneur who works as a roofer and in several other occupations, but makes most of his money being the star attraction at Club Xquisite, a male strip joint in Tampa that fills every weekend night with drunken, horny women eager to slide dollar bills between hard-bodied dudes and the G-strings they wear. While on a roofing job, Mike meets Adam (Alex Pettyfer), a misfit college dropout who lost a football scholarship when he punched his coach, and he decides to teach the kid how to become an exotic dancer. Mike introduces Adam to Dallas (Matthew McConaughey), the owner of the club, and gets him onto the crew of regular performers. As Dallas plans a big move for the troupe, Mike tries to start his dream business, falls for Adam's sister, and sees Adam fall to the temptations of the stripper life

programme.title: American Pie

programme.desc: In this comedy, Jack Moniker (Robin Williams) and Ernest Reed (Jimmy Cliff) become partners in a deal to modernize a run-down Caribbean resort and turn it into a swank attraction for the rich and playful. Jack leaves behind his life as a fireman and Ernest hops to convert his talents as a reggae singer into administrative prowess. Multiple sketches involve a range of quirky and complaining guests at the resort, and exactly how their complaints are handled. In the meantime, the corrupt prime minister of the island (Adolph Caesar) plans to sell the lot to an international corporation

programme.title: Bad Santa

programme.title: Double Take
programme.desc: Slick banker Daryl Chase (Orlando Jones) unwittingly becomes involved in a murder and embezzlement scheme in this laugh-filled action film. When gangsters and covert agents come after Daryl, he switches identities with a fast-talking street hustler (Eddie Griffin). Gary Grubbs, Daniel Roebuck, Edward Herrmann

programme.title: Love Potion No. 9
programme.desc: When it comes to love, Paul Matthews and Diane Farrow, two highly educated and talented scientists don't know a thing. Despite the fact that they are neighbors, share the same interests and both are psychobiologists who study primates, neither is really aware of the other romantically until Paul, who is terribly shy around women, goes to gypsy Madame Ruth in desperation and asks for help. She reads his palm and tells him that he needs a woman; she then hands him Love Potion No. 8 which will attract women like flies to honey. After experimenting on animals, both Paul and Diane decide to try it on themselves... with hilarious and charming results!

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must reevaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her

programme.title: Not Another Teen Movie
programme.desc: In this teen movie genre parody, a cool high school quarterback bets he can turn a quirky misfit into a prom queen

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. But once he gets there, Craig and his cousin have a string of suburban adventures that make his South Central experiences look tame(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Van Wilder
programme.desc: Van Wilder might be starting his seventh year at Coolidge College, but graduation is the last thing on his mind. Armed with a personal assistant and a coterie of admirers, Van has reached the status of living legend on campus, throwing bashes that make geeks popular, raise money for charity and generally "inspire the uninspired. " But when Van's father refuses to pay any more of his son's tuition bills, Van must turn to party planning for profit in order to continue living in under-graduate bliss, thereby becoming the subject of an exposé by disapproving school journalist Gwen Pearson. What begins as a clash of wills, soon leads to unexpected romance as Van and Gwen both realize they have a lot to learn from each other. The only problem is Gwen's self-obsessed, frat house boyfriend, Richard, who is determined, at any cost, to put a stop to Van's rule as campus king(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Matt Damon and Heath Ledger play two con artist brothers who take advantage of local superstitions. Girls have been disappearing from a forest, and this time it may be real. Dir: Terry Gilliam(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Trainwreck'
programme.desc: A look at "Trainwreck," a 2015 comedy about a commitment-phobic woman who finds herself falling for the subject of an article she's writing for a men's magazine. The film stars Amy Schumer, Bill Hader and Tilda Swinton, and is written by Schumer and directed by Judd Apatow(n)

programme.title: McHale's Navy
programme.desc: Comedy adventure based on the 1960s American TV series of the same name and starring Tom Arnold as the titular Naval Commander. McHale and his men lead a charmed life stationed on a sleepy Caribbean island until the maniacal Major Vladakov (Tim Curry) invades a nearby island, putting a damper on the sailor's easy lifestyle!(n)

programme.title: Other People's Money
programme.desc: Corporate raider Larry 'The Liquidator' Garfield sees easy pickings in the cable company of stolid old Andrew Jorgenson. But the veteran and his wife won't go down without a fight, particularly with help from his lawyer daughter Kate. Will Larry's lust overcome his greed?(n)

programme.title: Wild Wild West
programme.desc: Will Smith and director Barry Sonnenfeld last struck gold with the international blockbuster Men In Black and they re-team for this rollicking action adventure movie that puts a brand new spin on the Western. Smith plays government agent Jim West, who finds himself paired with fellow agent Artemus Gordon when Dr Arliss Loveless plots to assassinate the President. Both West and Gordon have their unique talents - Jim is a witty charmer who can talk his way out of any situation, while Artemus is a master of disguise with a dazzling talent for inventing things - and they'll need every trick in the book if they're to outwit their new nemesis. Look out for some spectacular special effects, including a giant transportation device known as The Tarantula, as well as Salma Hayek, who co-stars as the sassy love interest(n)

programme.title: Fathers' Day
programme.desc: Hilarious comedy starring Robin Williams and Billy Crystal as a writer and an uptight lawyer who both team up to track down a runaway teen who each thinks might be his son(n)

programme.title: Appropriate Behavior
programme.desc: A bisexual woman from a staunchly traditional Persian family attempts to determine why her last relationship failed. Meanwhile, she stages silent acts of rebellion in response to her brother's recent engagement(n)

programme.title: High Fidelity
programme.desc: When record shop owner Rob is dumped by his latest girlfriend, he compiles a list of his top five worst break-ups and attempts to reconnect with the ladies in question. Meanwhile, he and his oddball assistants contemplate the effect their love of music has had on their lives(n)

programme.title: Meet the Spartans
programme.desc: From the creators of Scary Movie and Date Movie comes this tongue-in-cheek parody of the sword-and-sandal epics, dubbed Meet the Spartans. The 20th Century Fox production was written and directed by the filmmaking team of Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer. Sure, Leonidas may have nothing more than a cape and some leather underwear to protect him from the razor-sharp swords of his Persian enemies, but that won't stop the brave leader and his team of 13 warriors from defending their beloved homeland against a powerful invading force that includes the likes of a mutant Paris Hilton, the Transformers, the Ghost Rider, and Rocky Balboa(n)

programme.title: Super Troopers
programme.desc: "Police Academy" meets "Animal House" in this raucous romp written by and starring the Broken Lizard comedy troupe. Jay Chandrasekhar, Kevin Heffernan, Paul Soter, Steve Lemme and Erik Stolhanske play Vermont state police officers battling crime and sparring with the local cops, who are trying to get them ousted. Lynda Carter, Daniel von Bargen. Chandrasekhar also directed(n)

programme.desc: When record shop owner Rob is dumped by his latest girlfriend, he compiles a list of his top five worst break-ups and attempts to reconnect with the ladies in question. Meanwhile, he and his oddball assistants contemplate the effect their love of music has had on their lives(n)

programme.title: Bicentennial Man
programme.desc: Warm and funny tale starring Robin Williams. An ordinary household is turned upside down when a robot purchased as an appliance starts to develop a heart(n)

programme.title: Charlotte's Web
programme.desc: This animated musical, based on E.B. White's children's book classic, is about a courageous spider who helps save the life of an ill-fated pig. Wilbur is a young pig (voice of Henry Gibson) who's owned by New England farmer Homer Zuckerman (voice of Robert Holt). One day he is sold to a neighbor, where he meets a sheep who warns him that his fate lies in the confines of the slaughterhouse. Wilbur is terrified of this news until he meets Charlotte, a charming spider (voice of Debbie Reynolds), who is determined to save Wilbur from this dire destiny. By weaving words into her web, she convinces the farmer that Wilbur is some sort of prodigious animal too important to kill. The music for Charlotte's Web was written by Richard M. Sherman and Robert B. Sherman, who wrote the scores for countless Disney movies, including Mary Poppins and The Jungle Book(n)

programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as a fast-talking thief who's released from prison by federal agents because they think he knows the location of a stash of gold stolen by his late cellmate. But the dead man's partner is also watching, under the same assumption, and he isn't about to let the Feds---or a small-time, smart-aleck crook---stand in his way. David Morse, Robert Pastorelli, Doug Hutchison(n)

programme.title: The Last of the Blonde Bombshells
programme.desc: Elizabeth, the youngest of The Blonde Bombshells, recalls her days during the Second World War when the group entertained the nation. When she meets up with Patrick, the only male member of the group, she has the idea on reforming the band to play together again for one last time(n)

programme.title: Bless the Child
programme.desc: A spiritual war is at the core of this thriller starring Kim Basinger and Jimmy Smits. Nurse Maggie O'Connor (Basinger) joins forces with FBI agent John Travis (Smits) to wage a battle against a shady satanic cult headed by the fiendish Eric Stark (Rufus Sewell), who plans to use O'Connor's gifted 6-year-old niece to further the group's evil cause. Holliston Coleman, Christina Ricci(n)

programme.title: Dark Blue
programme.desc: A cop's personal code of justice begins to change after a number of incidents lead his city to a tragic wave of violence in this police drama. Eldon Perry (Kurt Russell) is a veteran cop with the LAPD's Special Investigations unit, a man who isn't above bending the law if it means putting people behind bars who deserve the treatment. As Los Angeles waits on the verdict in the Rodney King police beating trial, Perry is presenting testimony to Assistant Chief of Police Arthur Holland (Ving Rhames), who is well aware of the corruption in the SIS unit and wants to stop it. Perry, however, twists some facts as he speaks in the defense of his new partner, Bobby Keough (Scott Speedman), who is being investigated for inappropriate use of deadly force. For lack of honest testimony, Keough is let off the hook, and soon he and Perry have a new case to investigate -- a robbery at a liquor store than turned into a quadruple homicide. Perry and Keough quickly track down two likely suspects, Orchard (Kurupt) and Sidwell (Dash Mihok), but Perry is surprised when the head of SIS, Van Meter (Brendan Gleeson), tells him to let Orchard and Sidwell go, and instead points the finger at two ex-cons who should be taken off the street, even though they're innocent of this crime. Perry follows Van Meter's orders, despite Keough's misgivings, but in the wake of the L.A. riots, Perry has a change of heart, and decides to start working with Holland against Van Meter's corrupt methods. In the midst of it all, Perry is trying to hold together his troubled marriage to Sally (Lolita Davidovich), while Keough finds himself romancing a fellow officer, Beth (Michael Michele). Dark Blue was adapted from an original screenplay by noted crime novelist James Ellroy; originally set against the backdrop of the 1965 Watts riots, the story was later updated to 1992(n)

programme.title: My Story
programme.sub-title: My Story: Childhood During the Highland Clearances.
programme.desc: Grandad James takes Iona on a journey of discovery to find out what life was like for a child from the Highlands of Scotland over 200 years ago. Iona and grandad James dress up in clothes from the time known as the Highland Clearances. They learn about a boy called Lachlan and why he, and many other families, had to leave their homes and move to a new country. Together they discover what life was like for Lachlan in Scotland - where he would live, the language he spoke, the food he would have eaten and the jobs he would do to help his family. Iona and grandad James then visit an American township to see how different Lachlan's new life in America would have been and they try their hand at panning for gold.(n)
